name: Land perimeter
description:
Given an array `arr` of strings, complete the function by calculating the total perimeter of all the islands. Each piece of land will be marked with `'X'` while the water fields are represented as `'O'`. Consider each tile being a perfect `1 x 1` piece of land. Some examples for better visualization:

```text
['XOOXO',
 'XOOXO',
 'OOOXO',
 'XXOXO',
 'OXOOO'] 
```

which represents:

<svg style="max-width: 300px" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 400 400" xmlns:bx="https://boxy-svg.com">
  <defs/>
  <rect x="60" y="60" width="300" height="300" style="stroke: rgb(0, 0, 0); fill: rgb(255, 255, 255); stroke-width: 5px;"></rect>
  <path style="fill: rgb(216, 216, 216); stroke: rgb(0, 0, 0); stroke-width: 5px;" d="M 120 360 L 120 60"></path>
  <path style="fill: rgb(216, 216, 216); stroke: rgb(0, 0, 0); stroke-width: 5px;" d="M 180 360 L 180 60"></path>
  <path style="fill: rgb(216, 216, 216); stroke: rgb(0, 0, 0); stroke-width: 4px;" d="M 240 360 L 240 60"></path>
  <path style="fill: rgb(216, 216, 216); stroke: rgb(0, 0, 0); stroke-width: 4px;" d="M 300 360 L 300 60"></path>
  <path style="fill: rgb(216, 216, 216); stroke: rgb(0, 0, 0); stroke-width: 4px;" d="M 60 120 L 360 120"></path>
  <path style="fill: rgb(216, 216, 216); stroke: rgb(0, 0, 0); stroke-width: 4px;" d="M 60 180 L 360 180"></path>
  <path style="fill: rgb(216, 216, 216); stroke: rgb(0, 0, 0); stroke-width: 4px;" d="M 60 240 L 360 240"></path>
  <path style="fill: rgb(216, 216, 216); stroke: rgb(0, 0, 0); stroke-width: 4px;" d="M 60 300 L 360 300"></path>
  <rect x="60" y="60" width="60" height="120" style="fill: rgb(255, 0, 0); stroke: rgb(255, 220, 0); stroke-width: 5px;"></rect>
  <rect x="240" y="60" width="60" height="240" style="fill: rgb(255, 0, 0); stroke: rgb(255, 220, 0); stroke-width: 5px;"></rect>
  <path d="M 180 240 L 180 360 L 120 360 L 120 300 L 60 300 L 60 240 Z" style="fill: rgb(255, 0, 0); stroke: rgb(255, 220, 0); stroke-width: 5px;"></path>
</svg>

should return: `"Total land perimeter: 24"`.

Following input:

```text
['XOOO',
 'XOXO',
 'XOXO',
 'OOXX',
 'OOOO']
```

which represents:
